title: Mikheil Kavelashvili sworn in as Georgia's president amid political tensions
snippet: As she departed, she declared she was taking with her “legitimacy, the flag, and your trust” and vowed to continue her struggle. Last Sunday, Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze stated that Zourabichvili must vacate her post on the ...

title: Anti-Western Kavelashvili sworn in as Georgia's president, pro-EU Zourabichvili disputes legitimacy
snippet: Georgian anti-Western politician Mikheil Kavelashvili, an ally of the ruling Georgian Dream party, was inaugurated as the country's sixth president on Dec. 29 in a move seen as illegitimate by the opposition.

title: Utkarsh
snippet: Former footballer Mikheil Kavelashvili was elected as the new President of Georgia on 14 December, 2024.

title: Georgia: Ex-footballer Mikheil Kavelashvili named president
snippet: Georgia's outgoing pro-Western president, Salome Zourabichvili, has condemned Kavelashvili's election as a travesty, insisting she holds Georgia's only remaining legitimate institution. ... Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze has accused Zourabichvili of trying to harm Georgia's interests, emphasising that when her term of office ends on 29 December, she will have to retire.
